Very short campaign but not a bad one at all. Had some nice crossover with the other campaigns and had a good flow to it. Never became frustrating or stale. Goes well with the other two. It is worth a playthrough.
An elegant game for a more civilized age.

Classic example of what a video game should be: no microtransactions, no pay to play, none of that contemporary BS. Just an awesome old school game with an awesome backstory and an awesome map with lots of stuff to solve, fight through, strategize about.
its cool
Great short expansion to half life.

This game depicts the life of a security guard inside Black Mesa Research Facility on THAT day. It gives you a more in-depth idea of what Barney Calhoun had to go through while Gordon was trying to get out of the facility. This was the second DLC released for the original Half-Life, and unfortunately a bit shorter than the first one, Opposing Force.
If you like the Half-Life world and story, definitely worth playing through at least once in your life.

As a game it's quite clunky by today's standards, but it has some depth so points for that. 4/10.

The life of a security guard in Black Mesa Research Facility on that very special day.
Unfold the story of what Barney Calhoun had to go through as Gordon Freeman was struggling his way to safety.
This is the 2nd expansion to Half-Life, it's a bit shorter and easier then the first expansion (Opposing Force).
But it's still the Half-Life world, and i love every bit of it. This was also a story i didn't get to play through as a child when it was new.
Great game!
I can't remember what happens in this game, but it was still pretty good.

J'ai relancÃ© le jeu en 2019, alors on ne va pas se mentir, les graphismes font trÃ¨s old school aujourd'hui.
Par contre, cela se termine (en 6 heures avec l'aide d'internet pour certains passages) et le jeu a le mÃ©rite de faire revivre les mÃ©caniques du 1er Half-Life.
Si vous Ãªtes nostalgique du 1er Half Life et que vous voulez prolonger l'aventure, c'est un peu le but de ce jeu donc vous Ãªtes sur la bonne voie si vous souhaitez vous y (re)mettre.

Half-Life: Blue Shift jest caÅ‚kiem dobrÄ… grÄ… do dziÅ›.  SkoÅ„czenie zajmuje kilka godzin. Åšwietna, wciÄ…gajÄ…ca akcja, rewelacyjny klimat, fabuÅ‚a ciekawie poprowadzona. 
Blue Shift kontynuuje wszystkie dobre tradycje do ktÃ³rych przyzwyczaiÅ‚a nas seria Half-Life, jednoczeÅ›nie dajÄ…c moÅ¼liwoÅ›Ä‡ spojrzenia na akcjÄ™ z zupeÅ‚nie nowej perspektywy.

Alors... Ce jeu est et restera injouable, tant que vous n'aurez pas ouvert la console en jeu, pour entrer la commande "m_rawinput1", et si un autre joueur n'avait pas rendu service Ã  bien d'autres (dont moi) en communicant cette info, ce jeu serait absolument inutilisable en l'Ã©tat.
DONC, une fois que vous avez validÃ© la commande, vÃ©rifiez... Ã§a ne marche toujours pas ! C'est normal : c'est Valve ! -_-
Du coup, la commande a quand mÃªme servi Ã  rajouter une option dans le menu des options de jeu, onglet "souris". Cochez-la, cliquez sur Appliquer, avant de revenir au jeu... Et lÃ , Ã§a marche ! Il a fallu que ce soit un mec qui donne anonymement la solution (Ã  mon avis un joueur) alors que Valve semblait ne pas savoir comment le rÃ©soudre.
Pour info', Ã  une Ã©poque j'avais les jeux du "bundle", en version physique, matÃ©rielle. Alors bon, payer 11â‚¬ pour les ravoir sur steam, ok, pas grand chose aprÃ¨s tout, mais si en 2005 les jeux fonctionnaient Ã  merveille, et que 15ans + tard il faut faire des manip' pour "dÃ©buguer" les jeux, afin qu'ils soient de nouveau jouables... Il faudrait m'expliquer un truc, lÃ  ! Parce que si ma mÃ©moire est bonne, ce sont les mecs de Valve, qui ont fait les jeux de ce bundle, qui ont par la suite crÃ©e Steam :)
Voila, donc est-ce que je le recommande Ã  prÃ©sent ? Pfff...Oui. Mais je persiste Ã  dire qu'effectuer des manip' dans la console et le menu des options, pour pouvoir simplement jouer Ã  un jeu aussi simple que celui-ci, Ã§a ne fait pas pro' du tout, surtout quand on a en mÃ©moire qu'ils marchaient impeccablement 15 ans auparavant !
Enfin, aprÃ¨s ce bon coup de gueule, j'admet que le plaisir est toujours lÃ , mÃªme en 2019. Un bon amusement et surtout un bon dÃ©fouloir.

Not as great as Half-Life: Opposing Force, but still very enjoyable â€“ diverse levels, engaging story â€“ but overall nothing new (no new weapons or enemies).

What surprised me was some puzzles primarily based on manipulation of several objects, although the GoldSrc engine has virtually no support for physical simulation. These puzzles were therefore frustrating (boxes and barrels flying in all directions, just not where I wanted them). Like physical simulation, the GoldSrc engine is not very good at AI. It took me a lot of work to bring Dr. Rosenberg to the elevator, because he just didnâ€™t want to follow me on such a long distance (for example, he suddenly decided to return across the whole level to his starting position).

In contrast to Half-Life: Opposing Force, I was pleased with higher default FOV and higher sound quality.

With the exceptions mentioned above, I enjoyed the game and I can recommend it.

The shorter of the two Half-Life 1 expansions (at about 3 hours playtime), this instalment lets you see the catastrophe from Barney Calhoun perspective, he is a Level 3 Security Guard working for the Black Mesa Security Force. Things soon go wrong as your run along side the events of Half-Life 1 and ultimately must fight to escape the facility. Although fun, it is significantly shorter than Opposing Force and contains a little bit less to do in general, also the weapons available to Barney are limited. Worth playing if you are a fan of the Half-Life universe or classic FPS titles, I wouldn't say this is absolutely necessary for everyone to experience but most will enjoy this!

A very short expansion for Half-Life. While it is not as fresh and original as Half-Life: Opposing Force or Half-Life, its still an alright game. None of the encounters are very challenging, no new weapons or enemies and an escort mission that if you walk 10 feet ahead of him, he stops moving. I'd only play/buy it if you are big on the Half-Life experience.
